page.title: 15THE SEWAGE WORKS
page.content: A complete sewage scheme for Wolverhampton was adopted in 1867. The Barnhurst Works are the largest and oldest of the Town's four sewage works and serves a resident population of 119,000 plus a large industrial population. Wolverhampton straddles the main watershed of England and therefore has no large river into which inferior effluent can pass unnoticed. Effluent from Barnhurst flows into the Shropshire Union and Staffordshire and Worcestershire Canals. It thus requires a high level of treatment before it can be discharged into an area used for recreational purposes. To ensure this twenty men work shifts to keep the Works operating 24 hours a day throughout the year. The effluent passes through a series of processes before being discharged into the canals
